moves.1. d4 d5 2. e3 Nc6 3. c4: This was the start of the themed mini tournament.
moves.3... e6: I rather like this more than playing Nf6!? Because if he captures on d5 and I recapture with the knight, not only do I not have very much central control, but he can gain a tempo by advancing his e pawn.
moves.4. a3: ?! Wasted move, as it does is prevents my DSB from going to b4, which wouldn't be a big problem for him.
moves.4... Bd6 5. cxd5 exd5: I'm not sure I liked that exchange for white. It did trade a side pawn for a center one, but it allows my to develop my LSB.
moves.6. Bd2 Bd7: This seemed to be the natural spot to put it, does anyone have any opinions where I should have moved it?
moves.7. b4: Maybe a little too early to do this. I'm not going to castle queenside now.
moves.7... Nf6 8. b5 Ne7: I think black is a little better now. Black has all his minor pieces out, white has one. Also,white has that b pawn strung out way ahead of the a pawn which is backward.
moves.9. Nc3 O-O: I castle. I am going to try to get my pieces more active, and press me opponent for not developing.
moves.10. f3: This isn't a *Terrible* move as it takes away a nice outpost for me on e4, but I would class it as an inaccuracy because it's weakening and he could just take my knight with his should it decide to sit on e4.
moves.10... Nf5 11. a4: ?! I'm not sure what he's doing with those queenside pawns, but he needs to develop.
moves.11... Qe7: Threatens to win his e pawn.
moves.12. Qb3: Well... development but at the wrong time.
moves.12... Nxe3 13. Bxe3 Qxe3+: Wham! suddenly my queen appears looming over the WK
moves.15. Nh3: ?! It develops it but I can take it and split up his pawns at the same time. I think he should have waited for a better time to do this.
moves.15... c5: His knight's not really going anywhere, so I thought I'd play this first.
moves.16. Qc2: ?! allows me to win a pawn and remove a defender of the bishop.
moves.16... cxd4 17. Kf1: ? He overlooks his knight in an attempt to get his king to safety.
moves.17... Bxh3: I can safely split his pawns before I take his knight.
moves.20. Bd3: Deals with it, but allows mate in two.
